intro: Toquera tomentosa, commonly known as the woolly toquera, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat and sorrel. The plant is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. It typically grows in moist, shady environments, often found in forest understories. Its botanical features make it an important component of the local ecosystem, supporting various pollinators and wildlife.
